job_title: Medical Laboratory Technician I (MLT) in Providence, RI
pros: Nice people and learn a lot
cons: Kinda like working in a factory

pros: Love the purpose behind my kids
cons: They show favoritism to certain employees

review_title: It feels like it's just another job.
job_title: Hospital Services Representative in Providence, RI
pros: Great benefits. Management sometimes brings in snacks for everyone. It's also a small department so it feels like a close knit family. If you like a lot of overtime and have a lot of time on your hands. You'll love this job.
cons: Pay could be better. In this department you are likely to work overtime at least once a week or more. There is no work/life balance in this job. You start to feel like you live at your job. If that is not what you're looking for, this is not the job for you. Training could also be improved. Many workers feel like they are being thrown into the job, not fully trained.

pros: Great environment, great people to work with
cons: Not great communication between upper level staff and those in the lab

pros: You get good benefits and the training program they have is the best I've experienced. They make sure you are comfortable with what you are doing before you work on it alone and they train you based on your pace, not theirs. You get to work alone majority of the time. SO if you like independent work, this is the job for you.
cons: There is not enough positivity being passed around in the company. You need to find reasons to be happy working here because the job is so repetitive and the workers have drama. BUT, as long as you keep to yourself and do your job and not get involved, you should be fine. In summary, the environment isn't as professional as I would want it to be.

review_title: Factory Work. Blind leading the blind.
pros: Large new facility, a few good people sprinkled amid the ever changing staff. Bad attitudes prevail, those with the desire to grow and learn move on quickly.
cons: Cronyism, high workload antiquated systems, lack of unity between departments. Company culture embraces individuals with diverse mental health disorders.

job_title: Medical Laboratory Technician in Providence, RI
pros:
Can be flexible to some degree with hours, etc
Small company - friendly atmosphere
Good benefits
cons:
Not much room for growth
Some management is underqualified or extremely rude
Given a lot more work with no incentives

review_title: Rhode Island Blood Center employs Heroes
pros: Both employers and employees are very energetic as well as being supportive of each other.  The hours are flexible and many part-time position available.  They also have many benefits for their employees.
cons: As a tele-recruitment employee, we would all support each other - but more employees are needed to complete and make the task successful.

pros:
*Benefit package is beautiful

*There are some genuinely nice people who work at this org/location

*If you're looking for an opportunity to work there, chances are there will always be an opening because it appear that people are constantly coming and going

*if you are a quick learner, you're in the right place. If you also enjoy random moments of boredom where you have to look like you're being productive even though there is absolutely nothing to do, you may enjoy it too
cons:
*It seems as if most of the people who work there are only there because they're related to someone. So if you're not relate to someone in the org, chances are, you won't get hired post interview

*Theres definitely favorites. And if it's your word against a favorite, regardless of your work ethic, you're going to lose

*You will get written up for nearly anything and won't know. Someone could be smiling in your face and right behind you causing you damage to your integrity as an employee

*Employees who have been there for 5+ years nonchalantly use their phones in the bathroom/hallways, talk about their inappropriate personal life while on the job, etc and don't get in trouble. Whereas other employees who have a simple basic/quick conversation that popped up with a peer will get in trouble asap

*Raises are once a year and they're only a few cents... literally. Thus, 0 room for advancing financially and also position (unless you're a select favorite)

*Gossip central. But obviously it's okay for the "senior" employees to do it 

*Most lab members are afraid of senior management because its not approachable and rarely smiles or says hi, just walks right by you (unless you're a favorite, a fellow supervisor, or someone from a regulatory place of course)

*Even if you go above and beyond your task for the shift, you will receive basically 1% of gratitude... supervisors treat you as if you're supposed to go the extra 3 miles and still harass you as if you're not doing enough (when you are). They just claim they'e been in your shoes at the org (as if the workload was the same during their time in your position)

review_title: Too many cliques, upper management plays favorites
job_title: Donor Services Specialist in Woonsocket, RI
pros: Great benefits. Great donors that make all the difference.
cons:
Upper management listens only to their favorite employees. Not both sides of anything.
Only hires part time. Crazy hours.

pros: make your schedule with various accounts.
cons: Under paid working very long hours
